image.altText: A middle-aged woman stands in a garden

props.synopsis: Tasmania's commission of inquiry into child sexual abuse was scathing about failures to protect school children, leaving some asking whether they are safe now.

title.children: 'Children don't lie': Plea to act on kids reporting sexual abuse as Tasmanian inquiry fears abusers still in schools

image.altText: Boy walking away angry from his parent

props.synopsis: The care of Tasmanian kids taken from their parents by child protection authorities should be outsourced, an inquiry finds, but some experts are worried.

title.children: 'They've done it with aged care, NDIS — both systems are failing': Doubts over outsourcing care of children

image.altText: A helicopter dropping water onto a bushfire.

props.synopsis: Under the new system, parts of Australia have already faced catastrophic warnings this fire season. But some of those alerts were wrong.

title.children: Australia's new $11m fire warning system is exaggerating the risks, ABC investigation reveals

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese wearing a Yes hooded sweatshirt during a press conference.

props.synopsis: This week we witnessed the beginning of managing expectations when Anthony Albanese started framing what he might say if the nation votes No on October 14, writes Patricia Karvelas.

title.children: It's brutal Politics 101, but Albanese is already prepping for the day after the referendum

image.altText: A man sits at a table covered in drinks as he waves a cigarette in his hand.

props.synopsis: A powerful village chief invited dozens of police officers to his house for a wild party. But when one of them wound up dead, it kicked off a huge scandal that threatens the unchecked power of Thailand’s authorities.

title.children: Dozens of powerful men sat down for a dinner party in Thailand. The night ended with murder

image.altText: An illustration of a particle and an antiparticle in purple and orange

props.synopsis: Attempts to understand why there is much more matter in the Universe than antimatter have been dealt a blow with an experiment ruling out one of the major explanations.

title.children: 'A huge puzzle': Antimatter falls just like ordinary matter, leaving the Universe's biggest mystery unsolved

image.altText: A for sale sign outside a suburban home

props.synopsis: A "slight uptick" in inflation is unlikely to see the Reserve Bank lift rates at its October meeting, but households facing a fixed-rate mortgage cliff are warned to brace for higher repayments.

title.children: Half a million households brace for higher interest rates by the end of the year as the mortgage cliff looms

image.altText: A drone shot of people on an island

props.synopsis: On a remote beach in Solomon Islands, family members sort out their differences with spears.

title.children: On a remote beach in Solomon Islands, family members sort out their differences via spear fight

image.altText: A black and white collage of two women - one with short hair and one with long hair - looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Some of the disability royal commission's most compelling evidence has come from mothers who lost their children. On the eve of the final report, two mums share their stories and hopes for the future.

title.children: Nella's daughter died in disability care. She wants to make sure no-one else goes through the same pain

props.synopsis: Townsville is emerging as Australia's new Army capital with hundreds of soldiers to be relocated over coming years, while Adelaide becomes the home of advanced land-based, long-range strike technology.

title.children: Townsville emerges as new 'capital' of Army in Defence Forces shake up

image.altText: Flames above a large battery box behind a fence at night time

props.synopsis: E-scooters, e-bikes and renewable energy storage in the form of batteries are rapidly increasing in popularity, but they’re creating another problem.

title.children: Lithium batteries are increasing in popularity, but they're creating another problem

image.altText: A man in a suit, seen from behind, looks at the ASX share price boards.

props.synopsis: Australia's stock market is expected to have a lacklustre morning after another mixed session on Wall Street overnight.

title.children: Local market tipped to open lower, new retail trade and job vacancies data to come

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Good morning, The local market is expected to lose some value this morning, after a mixed session on Wall Street overnight. After yesterday's monthly inflation indicator showed the impact of resurgent petrol prices, today we'll be getting updated data on retail trade, job vacancies, and household wealth. That will be useful information ahead of next week's Reserve Bank Board meeting, which will be Michele Bullock's first as governor. It's Thursday, but I feel like I can see Friday on the horizon. Let's see how things go today.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX to lose ground early

children.content: The local market is expected to lose some value this morning, after a mixed session on Wall Street overnight.
After yesterday's monthly inflation indicator showed the impact of resurgent petrol prices, today we'll be getting updated data on retail trade, job vacancies, and household wealth.
That will be useful information ahead of next week's Reserve Bank Board meeting, which will be Michele Bullock's first as governor.
It's Thursday, but I feel like I can see Friday on the horizon.
Let's see how things go today.

image.altText: Donald Trump Ivanka, Melania, Barron, and Don Jr stand together looking solemn

props.synopsis: A New York judge has ruled that former US president Donald Trump committed fraud when he lied about his wealth for a decade, defrauding banks and insurers as he built his real estate empire. So what is his real net worth?

title.children: Donald Trump's latest legal loss won't send him to prison. But it's a major financial setback for him and his family

image.altText: A "Go Freo!" sign on the side of the Woodside building in the Perth CBD.

props.synopsis: A prominent climate scientist says the AFL club's decision to sign a new multimillion-dollar sponsorship deal with the gas giant will not sit well with its younger supporters.

title.children: 'Shocked and dismayed': Fremantle Dockers slammed for re-signing Woodside as sponsor during 'climate crisis'

image.altText: Flares burn off methane and other hydrocarbons at an oil and gas facility in Lenorah, Texas

props.synopsis: Corporate titans exchange blows over the rocketing cost of gas in Western Australia, where prices have eclipsed even those in the eastern states.

title.children: Claims of exploitation and 'absurd' tactics as corporate heavyweights go to war over WA gas prices

image.altText: Glenn Maxwell celebrates as Virat Kohli walks away.

props.synopsis: The old adage catches win matches is proven true once again when Glenn Maxwell stops a rocket from Rohit Sharma to catch the India skipper and turn the tide of the third ODI in Rajkot.

title.children: Maxwell takes a blinder of a catch as Australia puts cricket world on notice ahead of ODI World Cup

image.altText: man in bed smiling

props.synopsis: A friend of critically ill surfing great Mark Richardson says his situation has become so dire that medical evacuation is his only chance of survival.

title.children: Surfing great evacuated to Australia as friend warns 'he'll die if he stays'

image.altText: Penrith Panthers captain Isaah Yeo stands off to the side while partner Ashley Camenzuli gets her train adjusted at the Dally M.

props.synopsis: It was time to leave the boots at home and add a touch of glamour as the NRL and NRLW's biggest names attended the red carpet at this year's Dally M Awards.

title.children: A glimpse at some of the best red carpet arrivals at the 2023 Dally M Awards

image.altText: Compilation of three people in front of suburban background

props.synopsis: Western Sydney community leaders speak about the Voice referendum's Yes and No campaigns' attempts to win over members of Australia's culturally diverse communities.

title.children: 'More focused on living expenses': Multicultural community leaders say the Voice referendum is getting lost

image.altText: Some shrubs in the foreground near a KFC restaurant, with striking red architecture.

props.synopsis: The woman says she wanted to leave the Canberra restaurant so she could pump her breasts with privacy, but she was told she needed to stay on site.

title.children: KFC discriminated against breastfeeding manager by telling her to express milk in a toilet tent, tribunal finds

image.altText: A hand holds a phone which shows a downloading sign, and one bar of 3G signal.

props.synopsis: Farmers in western New South Wales say they have already seen a significant drop in 3G phone service, months ahead of major telcos' timelines to phase it out.

title.children: 3G will be turned off within 12 months, but farmers say service is already declining

image.altText: A bright pink building fascade with row of black-framed windows at top and bottom. Small 'P' sign stands at far left.

props.synopsis: Almost 3 million apartments or townhouses in Australia are covered by a strata scheme. What happens when it causes trouble?

title.children: Strata committees do important work. They can also cause a lot of grief. Here's how to keep things amicable

image.altText: Uncle Gary Williams stands in front of an Indigenous mural at the Muurbay Language Centre

props.synopsis: Gumbaynggirr-Bundjalung man Gary Williams understands how confronting standing up to social convention can be. He's taken "frightening" stands all his life.

title.children: Freedom rider who confronted deep racism with Charles Perkins has empathy for Voice voters

image.altText: moose sweden railway

props.synopsis: A moose on a day out in Stockholm pays the ultimate price for causing hours of havoc on the Swedish capital's public transport system.

title.children: Moose on the loose in Stockholm subway creates havoc before being shot dead

image.altText: A blond woman wearing a blazer stands in front of a police station

props.synopsis: CCTV footage between a service station attendant and Nine News Darwin's senior crime reporter, Georgie Dickerson, is played to the court.

title.children: Nine News reporter pleads not guilty to impersonating a police officer

image.altText: A black bear eating tacos and enchiladas at a family picnic, while a woman shields the face of a child

props.synopsis: A hungry black bear interrupts a family picnic, devouring enchiladas and tacos.

title.children: Hungry black bear scares family after stealing picnic meal
